channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12761] On region jump ClientScanners should get next row start key instead of a skip.
item.description:
While working on async scanner I had some trouble with the extra RPC calls that happen to let the Scanner advance 1 row so it skips the last already known row.
This RPC call can be avoided by letting the start key be the last row with an appended 0. This saves quite some logic from the scanners and improves performance by saving extra RPC calls.
item.summary: On region jump ClientScanners should get next row start key instead of a skip.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• Remove all skip logic and let start row be the last row appended by 0
  • Fix existing CheckStyle issues with lines with 100+ chars and whitespace in the Scanner files.

This message is automatically generated.

Patch LGTM. Would be sweet if we could get away with this simplification (test failure looks related though). Input from Enis Soztutar and/or Devaraj Das would help since it looks like replicas code that is being mostly purged.

It seems that ScannerCallableWithReplicas reinvents its own scan progression code. It seems it can be done cleaner but I didn't want to mess in that code.

The new patch solves it in both places and fixes duplication on a reversed scan.

This message is automatically generated.

Jurriaan Mous Our zombie detector will pick up tests being run concurrently on the apache ci machines; we need to fix it. @enis or Devaraj Das, take a look at this nice cleanup. Good by you lot? Jurriaan Mous, what is up with your hoisting up this into ScannerCallableWithReplicas:

281 if(s.getScan().isReversed()){ '

Is this a bug fix? Nice work.

stack I noticed my previous patch return assert errors for too many results in reversed scans so I discovered I needed to contract the key for the reverse scans instead of advancing it with a 0. Previously the last result would be skipped on the server by the RPC scan I removed and that was a different key than the forward scanner. So this line is a bug fix compared to previous patch and not the current implementation.

stack I am on vacation presently.. Can't review the patch in detail until next week. But I did skim the patch. If it can wait until then, fine... If not, commit it if all tests pass and I'll have a look when I am back.
Devaraj Das Thanks for update boss.
I pushed this. Its very nice cleanup. Would be good to get the replicas perspective POV from Enis Soztutar and Devaraj Das when have a chance. Thanks Jurriaan Mous
